problems.title: Minimum Number Of K Consecutive Bit Flips (Sliding Window)
problems.description:
You are given a binary array nums and an integer k. A k-bit flip is choosing a subarray of length k and changing every 0 to 1 and 1 to 0. Return the minimum number of k-bit flips required so that there is no 0 in the array. If not possible, return -1.

Input Format:
First line: two integers n and k.
Second line: n space-separated integers (0s and 1s).

Output Format:
Print the minimum number of flips.
hintsList: Think about how to use a sliding window to optimize the solution.
Consider using a frequency map or two pointers to track the window state.
